fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

PDF product documentation for FishEye, Crucible, and Confluence are hosted in the Atlassian Cloud (Bitbucket.org) and redirected to Amazon AWS while the other product documentation is hosted directly on Atlassian.com.

If this is not known, we are unable to retrieve the PDF downloads on a restricted network.

h3. Suggested Solution

Please include a note or reference for those on restricted networks that the PDF documentation resides elsewhere to open up network access.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/alldoc/applications-and-tools-documentation-directory-209586313.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html

fields.description:
The [Custom authentication|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/custom-authentication-813695575.html] page, in "Per-repository constraint configuration" section, has this link in "Permissions Summary table": http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/6.+Setting+up+your+Users+and+Security. 

Clicking it takes you to a "Page Not Found", and the links from "In Other Spaces" are really outdated. Clicking in the most recent link listed there, for FishEye 1.6, takes you to: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE016/6.+Setting+up+your+Users+and+Security. 

However, removing the initial "6.+" from the page link (so that it looks like https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE016/Setting+up+your+Users+and+Security), takes you to another "Page Not Found", and then the links from "In Other Spaces" show that the latest version available for that document is for FishEye 2.7: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE027/Setting+up+your+Users+and+Security

This link for FishEye 2.7 really seems to be the latest one, however it's obviously really outdated as well, as FishEye's current latest version is 4.4.0.
fields.summary: Custom Authentication page links to outdated documentation

fields.description:
*Problem:*

In order to map existing users to committers FishEye has to scan through cached repository data. In case of large repositories with long commit history, it may take much time.

 

*Workaround:*

The dark feature implemented allows to disable search through repository data. User can still have a mapping by defining it explicitly:
 * via Administration > User Mappings 
 * or via user avatar > Profile

 

*How to enable it:*

Go to: [http://your_instance/plugins/servlet/global-dark-features]
 Enter: *atlassian.darkfeature.disable.implicit.committers* to the Feature Key textbox and click Enable.

 

*The dark feature is available in:*
 * 4.0.3-ea29981 (a dev build)
 * 4.4.1 (planned)
 * 4.5.0 (planned)
fields.summary: A dark feature flag to disable implicit committers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Any user starting with any of the letters present in the first 25 user entries (user name, display name or email address) will not be searchable using user auto-complete in the User Selector

h3. Environment

Any compatible browser is affected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 25 accounts named:
{noformat}
username: a1, Display-name: A1, email: a1@abc.example.com
...
username: a25, Display-name: A25, email: a25@abc.example.com
{noformat}

 # Create 1 additional account:
{noformat}
username: b1, Display-name: B1, email: b1@abc.example.com
{noformat}

 # Create a review
 # Try to mention user b1 in a comment

h3. Expected Results

User b1 gets showed in the selector.
h3. Actual Results

No user is found:
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-31 at 12.07.38.png|thumbnail!

It does not work either with full mention:
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-31 at 12.12.59.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround 1
 # Create 1 additional account:
{noformat}
username: z1, Display-name: ZB, email: z1@abc.example.com
{noformat}

 # Search for z1, it gets listed
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-31 at 12.16.14.png|thumbnail!
 # Now exact mention works for b1:
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-31 at 12.16.43.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround 2
Avoid user selector by directly typing markup for user mention. E.g. for user "{{b}}" type "{{\[\~b\]}}".
fields.summary: User Selector does not find user if more than 25 users contain the username starting letter in username or email address.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In instances having thousands of groups, configuring Global Permissions is painful because the user needs to type the group names one by one in the "Pick one or more groups" field.
 Some customers have also reported that the instance 'crashes' when lots of groups (for example, 50+) are added to the "Pick one or more groups" field, so they need to add groups in smaller batches.
h3. Suggested Solution

The Global Permissions page, when configuring groups, should either:
 # Present an option that allows granting the permission levels selected to all groups at once.
 *OR*
 # List all groups with a checkbox next to each of them, in order to allow selecting which ones to grant the permission levels selected.

h3. Workaround

Create one group per global permission type ({{fisheye-users}}, {{crucible-users}}, {{can-add-repository}}), grant global permissions to these groups and add all users to these groups.
fields.summary: Global Permissions: Configuring thousands of groups is painful

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As described in [FishEye reports|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/fisheye-reports-298976800.html], FishEye currently supports report function based on lines of code but doesn't support the one based on *numbers of changed files*.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice if FishEye support report function based on *numbers of changed files*.
 The customer assumed a chart like...
 * X-Axis : Time (Day, Week, Month)
 * Y-Axis : Number of files that were modified in a given period (In case the files are changed multiple times in the period, it should be counted once)

h3. Possible workaround

We can get the similar information with using [EyeQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/eyeql-reference-guide-298976796.html] and download it as a CSV.
h5. EyeQL query

To get the number of files that were changed (added, modified and deleted) on each day, use the following EyeQL query
{noformat}
select revisions
from dir "/"
where date >= 2016-01-01 and date < 2017-01-01
order by date
group by month
return count(distinct path), month{noformat}
adjusting the {{dir}} and {{date}} parameters according to needs. To get a per day report, change "month" to "day" in the query.

 h5. Example results

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create report based on numbers of changed files

fields.description:
We observed behaviour where full synchronisation with Crowd is taking 20..70 times more time to complete than JIRA or Confluence products.  Seems like this is something that could be tuned on FishEye/Crucible side.

Note: FishEye/Crucible (4.3.1) is also using older Embedded Crowd version (2.9.5) than JIRA/Confluence, there were some performance improvements introduced in 2.10 and 2.11 so upgrading Embedded Crowd may also improve this problem.
fields.summary: Full synchronisation in FECru may take order of magnitude longer than JIRA or Confluence

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 * use FishEye or Crucible 4.3.0 or later
 * in the installer wizard paste the Atlassian Stack license key
 * FishEye installer rejects the key with a message "You've entered a Crucible license"
 * Crucible installer rejects the key with a message "You've entered a FishEye license"

 

*Workaround:*
 * in the installer wizard use an evaluation key
 * after FishEye or Crucible is installed, navigate to Administration > System Settings > System Info > License > Edit license
 * paste the same Atlassian Stack license key into "FishEye" and "Crucible" input fields
fields.summary: FishEye setup page does not accept the Atlassian Stack license key

fields.description: The ability to save a custom review filter would save a lot of time. For example, when reviews are created but a user has not yet joined as a reviewer, the only way to view that review is via a custom filter that selects our specific project and the status of Open or Under Review. Selecting a different filter such as Inbox clears the custom filter and it must be set up again. The ability to save a custom filter alongside the preexisting Outbox, Inbox, etc. filters would save a lot of headache.

The "Learn more" link in the installation screen of FishEye links http://www.altassian.com/software/fisheye/ instead of http://www.atlassian.com/software/fisheye/.

The link points to the http://www.altassian.com/software/fisheye/ page (note the *lt* instead of *tl*).

No workaround available.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Log Analyzer fails to run when reverse proxy is configured
h3. Environment

FishEye/Crucible 4.2.1+ with a Reverse Proxy Configured with:
 {{Administration > Server > Web Server}} the following:
 * Proxy Scheme
 * Proxy Port
 * Proxy Host

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Reverse Proxy
 # Configure {{Administration > Server > Web Server}} :

 * Proxy Scheme
 * Proxy Port
 * Proxy Host

 # Run Log Analyzer using any of the 3 settings in the dropdown menu

h3. Expected Results

The logs should get scanned
h3. Actual Results

The logs don't get scanned and you automatically get the following message:
Hercules didn't find any known problems in the following log file: 
<path to file>
This happens without scanning the logs

!Screen Shot 2017-02-28 at 18.32.12.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

You can set up another instance of Fisheye/Crucible 
that does not have a proxy and point the Log Analyzer 
to your proxied instance.
fields.summary: Log Analyzer fails to run when reverse proxy is configured

fields.description:
At the moment enabling debug logging in Fisheye/Crucible does not enable logging for SQL queries. 

Though there is a [manual workaround|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fishkb/enabling-additional-logging-in-fisheye-crucible-740000165.html] to add the logger to {{log4j.xml}}, it would be great to have these added to the default debug logging or enable them via the application UI, whether by the click of a button or better still similar to [JIRA's implementation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-set-logging-level-for-a-package-in-jira-629178605.html].

This will result in better user experience and help avoid issues raised as a result of errors introduced due to manual editing of files.
fields.summary: Enable SQL logging via application UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As in a feature request [Support for IPv6|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-5702], we don't support IPv6 on FishEye at this moment.
 In [some knowledgebase|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fishkb/jira-users-can-t-login-to-fisheye-crucible-or-connecting-to-jira-for-user-management-fails-433391993.html], there seems to be some mentions about it. However, there isn't in our official docs.
h3. Suggested Solution

We should announce it on our official docs like [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/supported-platforms-298976955.html] as well.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

FishEye/Crucible fails to index a Git repository on Windows if that repository contains a file of name with both a space and certain UTF-8 characters. 

h3. Environment
* Windows
* Git 2.11.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the repository at https://bitbucket.org/atlassian-jeff/doc_test to FishEye running Windows
# Allow the repository to index

h3. Expected Results

Indexing completes without error.

h3. Actual Results

FishEye is passing in quotes to the {{astextplain}} script which results in the file extension not being matched. For example, the file extension is being passed in as {{.docx"}} which does not match {{.docx}}. Modifying {{astextplain}} can workaround this, simply add {{| .docx\"}} to the list:

{code}*.docx | *.DOCX | *.docm | *.DOCM | *.dotm | *.DOTM| .docx\"){code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When days are specified in smart commits through the usage of 'd' time unit character, such as in the example below, no time gets logged:
{noformat}
TST-1: Testing smart commits #time 1d
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate FishEye 4.2.1 with JIRA (tested with JIRA 6.4.14 and JIRA 7.2.6) through Application Links
# Ensure that OAuth consumer token has been accepted in both sides, allowing you to see JIRA issue details in FishEye side and commits / reviews in the JIRA issue
# (Likely optional) Create a user mapping, just to make sure that the repository committer will be mapped to a FishEye user
# Enable debug logging in FishEye
# Commit code using smart commits, and containing {{#time 1d}} in the commit message
# Wait until FishEye the new commit shows up in the repository activity stream
# Reload the JIRA ticket, ensuring to be in the {{Work Log}} tab, and check that the time was not logged.

h3. Expected Results
According to [Using Smart Commits|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/using-smart-commits-298976812.html] it should be possible to use the time unit 'd', respective to days, and it should log the number of days specified before the 'd' character in the issue.

    FishEye could not execute the smart commit because of an unexpected error: Time spent '1d' must be not null and greater then zero
    Please manually perform the required action within Crucible.
{noformat}

As a result of this error, no time gets logged in the JIRA issue. 

h3.Workaround
In JIRA, 1 day of work has 8 hours, so specifying the number of days * 8 as hours should work.
For example, supposing someone spent one full day and 3 hours the next day working on something, this person could use '11h' when logging time.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Migrating FishEye Database from MS SQL 2008 results in:
Database error at cwd_user
...
java.io.IOException: Error writing to the database
..
Restore failed. This may leave your target FISHEYE_INST directory  in an inconsistent state.

h3. Environment
MS SQL 2008
Any FishEye version

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 *Migrating from the FishEye Web UI*
# Go to {{Administration > Database}}
# Fill details for target Database
# Save and Migrate

*Command Line*
# Create back for your existing MS SQL 2008 database
# Run the following command:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
fisheyectl.sh restore --sql --file /path/to/backup.zip --dbtype <database type> --jdbcurl jdbc:<database-type-jdbc>://<hostname>:<port>/<database> --username <user name> --password <password> --force 
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Migration should complete successfully 
h3. Actual Results

*Command:*
{code:borderStyle=solid}
fisheyectl.sh restore --sql --file ../data-migration.zip --dbtype postgresql --jdbcurl jdbc:postgresql://<host>:5432/<database> --username <user> --password <passwd> --force  
{code}
*Error:*
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This is due to an incompatibility in date an timestamp format. Reason is sqlserver timestamp is saved as string, rather than a timestamp and FE is not able to restore that to New Target Database

{{cwd_user.created_date}} and {{cwd_user.updated_date}} have the following formats in {{sql/database.xml}}:

|| DB || date example ||
| H2 | {{<timestamp>2017-01-31T12:08:56.207Z</timestamp>}} |
| postgres | {{<timestamp>2017-01-31T12:08:56.207Z</timestamp>}} |
| mysql | {{<timestamp>2017-01-31T14:07:45.000Z</timestamp>}} |
| sql server 2008 | {{<escapedString>2017-01-31 12:33:06.2070000</escapedString>}} |

h3.Workaround

Manually correct the sql/database.xml file

{noformat}$ unzip backup.zip sql/database.xml
$ sed -E 's|<escapedString>([0-9]{4}-[0-9]{2}-[0-9]{2}) ([0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}\.[0-9]{3})0000</escapedString>|<timestamp>\1T\2Z</timestamp>|g' sql/database.xml > sql/database2.xml
$ mv sql/database2.xml sql/database.xml
$ zip -u backup.zip sql/database.xml{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

FishEye renders binary file in SVN repository as text when the filename contains *round brackets '(', ')'* and FishEye uses *native SVN* for the indexing. (This problem didn't happen when using *SVNKit*.)
This is different problem from the one which is mentioned in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fishkb/fisheye-renders-binary-file-in-svn-repository-as-text-792498092.html]. Even if {{svn:mime-type}} of the file is set to {{application/octet-stream}}, this problem could be reproduced.

h3. Environment
* Ubuntu 16.04
* SVN 1.9.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SVN repository
# Add any file to the repository and commit it (revision 1)
(i) This step is important. I couldn't reproduce this problem in case that I added the problematic file in the initial commit. You should commit the problematic file *after the initial commit*.
# Add a binary file named "(test).pptx" to the repository and commit it (revision 2)
# Make change in the binary file and commit it (revision 3)
# Configure FishEye to use native SVN
# Add the repository to FishEye
# Execute full re-indexing to the repository
# Check the diff between revision 2 and revision 3 on the UI

h3. Expected Results

"(test).pptx" should be handled as binary.

h3. Actual Results

"(test).pptx" was handled as text.
 
h3. Notes

As I mentioned above, in case that we added the problematic file to the repository in the *initial commit*, this problem couldn't be reproduced.
In order to reproduce this problem, we have to add the file to the repository *after the initial commit*.

When I reproduce this problem on my local, the following SVN commands seemed to be executed while re-indexing.

{code}
2017-01-20 00:49:25,855 DEBUG [InitPing1 test_native ] fisheye IndexingStats-dump - svn cat -r 3 http://vagrant.vm/svn/test/%28test%29.pptx@3 took 3 millis
2017-01-20 00:49:25,855 DEBUG [InitPing1 test_native ] fisheye IndexingStats-dump - svn info -r HEAD http://vagrant.vm/svn/test/@HEAD took 4 millis
2017-01-20 00:49:25,855 DEBUG [InitPing1 test_native ] fisheye IndexingStats-dump - svn info -R -r 2 http://vagrant.vm/svn/test/%28test%29.pptx@2 took 5 millis
2017-01-20 00:49:25,855 DEBUG [InitPing1 test_native ] fisheye IndexingStats-dump - svn proplist -r 1 http://vagrant.vm/svn/test/test.pptx@1 took 6 millis
2017-01-20 00:49:25,855 DEBUG [InitPing1 test_native ] fisheye IndexingStats-dump - svn diff --summarize -r 2:3 http://vagrant.vm/svn/test/@3 took 7 millis
2017-01-20 00:49:25,855 DEBUG [InitPing1 test_native ] fisheye IndexingStats-dump - svn info -R -r 1 http://vagrant.vm/svn/test@1 took 8 millis
2017-01-20 00:49:25,855 DEBUG [InitPing1 test_native ] fisheye IndexingStats-dump - svn diff -r 2:3 http://vagrant.vm/svn/test@3 took 10 millis
{code}

h3.Workaround

Please use SVNKit instead.

fields.description:
With the Crowd server existing in a different domain, Confluence and JIRA are able to overwrite the Crowd {{cookie.domain}} but post 4.0, FishEye/Crucible is not.

Previously, users could specify the {{cookie.domain}} in the FeCru {{config.xml}}.
h5. Scenario

||Application||Domain||Crowd Domain||Overwrite Domain||Results||
|Crowd|.foo.com|N/A|N/A|N/A|
|JIRA|.bar.com|.foo.com|.bar.com|Works|
|Confluence|.bar.com|.foo.com|.bar.com|Works|
|FeCru|.bar.com|.foo.com|.bar.com|Unable to overwrite|
h5. Request

Allow FeCru to overwrite the Crowd cookie.domain setting like JIRA and Confluence are able to do.

fields.description:
*Symptoms:*

Scanning P4 repository by FishEye using a command:
{noformat}
DEBUG [InitPing2 AlertCentral ] fisheye P4CliUtils-dumpCommandLine - [localhost:1666//depot] Executing C:\Perforce\p4.exe -p localhost:1666 -u readonly -ztag -x - changes -l 
{noformat}
stops with the following error in a stack trace:
{noformat}
DEBUG [InitPing2 AlertCentral ] fisheye P4Exec-getProcessStatusMessage - Exception processing P4 command - returning as status
com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "SOME TEXT"
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcessImpl.handleHandlerError(ExternalProcessImpl.java:273) [atlassian-processutils-1.5.14.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcessImpl.access$300(ExternalProcessImpl.java:18) [atlassian-processutils-1.5.14.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcessImpl$3.doTask(ExternalProcessImpl.java:317) [atlassian-processutils-1.5.14.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.LatchedRunnable.run(LatchedRunnable.java:36) [atlassian-processutils-1.5.14.jar:?]
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) [?:1.8.0_102]
Caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "SOME TEXT"
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at java.lang.Long.parseLong(Long.java:589) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at java.lang.Long.parseLong(Long.java:631) [?:1.8.0_102]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.client.P4Client$3.processGroup(P4Client.java:137) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.client.P4ZTagExtractor.processLine(P4ZTagExtractor.java:43) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.client.P4OutputLineProcessor.processOutput(P4OutputLineProcessor.java:34) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.client.P4Exec$3.process(P4Exec.java:193) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.PluggableProcessHandler.processOutput(PluggableProcessHandler.java:127) [atlassian-processutils-1.5.14.jar:?]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.util.NamedProcessHandler.processOutput(NamedProcessHandler.java:31) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcessImpl$3.doTask(ExternalProcessImpl.java:315) [atlassian-processutils-1.5.14.jar:?]
	... 4 more{noformat}
This can happen when a commit contains a multi-line comment and the next line of comment starts with: {{"... change"}} string. Example:
{noformat}
... change 785823
... time 1480677702
... user alice
... client ALICE
... status submitted
... changeType public
... path //depot/Src/...
... oldChange 785815
... desc first line of description
... change second line of description
{noformat}
 

*Cause:*

This is because FishEye scanner recognises "... change second line of description" from the description field as a start of new commit block from the log.

 

*Workaround:*

Edit existing commit comment and remove "... change" from the beginning of the line (e.g. remove dots or make it single-line):
 p4 change -f <change number>
 Note: this requires superuser permissions in Perforce.

 

*Expected bug fix:*

Recognise multi-line comment description.

fields.description: There have been a number of security issues in non-atlassian software caused by using the HOST header of an incoming request. Therefore, this suggestion issue to request that when FECRU sees a request with a HOST header that does not match the instance's server url to redirect the request to the server url.
fields.summary: Redirect requests that have a different HOST header than what is configured to the correct (configured) server url.

fields.description:
*Problem:*

FishEye/Crucible fails to render list of users in case one user is defined in two user directories and has 'fisheye user' global permission set in one of them, while in another directory is marked as inactive and the second directory has higher priority.

 

*Steps to reproduce:*
 * create a user in 'Internal' directory
 * by default this user will be granted 'fisheye user' and 'crucible user' global permissions
 * create the same user in external directory (JIRA), uncheck the 'active' checkbox
 * configure user directories: JIRA directory as first, internal directory as second
 * click 'synchronise' link
 * the "Users" list on administration page (/admin/userAdmin.do) shows this user
 * note: user has an empty avatar (grey icon), clicking on the user loads a page with "IllegalStateException user does not exist" error
 * an attempt to delete a user shows "success", but the user is still shown on the list
 * the global user list (/users) fails with the "cannot get committers for a non-existent Fisheye user" error:
  

{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: cannot get committers for a non-existent Fisheye user [jordi.nadal] at com.cenqua.fisheye.model.manager.CommitterUserMappingManagerImpl.getAllCommittersForUser(CommitterUserMappingManagerImpl.java:280) [fisheye.jar:?] ... at com.atlassian.fisheye.user.action.userlistgenerator.GlobalUserListGenerator.addCommitsToPeople(GlobalUserListGenerator.java:54) [fisheye.jar:?] at com.atlassian.fisheye.user.action.userlistgenerator.UserListGenerator.completeUserData(UserListGenerator.java:88) [fisheye.jar:?]
{noformat}

*Workaround:*
 * swap the order of user directories - i.e. to have the internal first, JIRA as second
 * delete the user - it will be removed from the internal directory (alternatively - remove it from 'fisheye-user' and 'crucible-users' groups to revoke user's global permissions)
 * switch the order of directories back
fields.summary: IllegalArgumentException cannot get committers for a non-existent Fisheye user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 The scenario is the following:
 * Two directories are present in Fisheye and they share at least one user
 * The user is inactive the first of the two directories and active in the other one
 * FishEye syncs the two directories and syncs the user being it active in one of the two directories
 * When the user name is clicked in the user list a check is performed in the directories to see if the user is present in them.
 The check is performed from the first directory until the last one and it stops when it succeeds or fails with an error.
 * The user directory with the inactive user is checked and it returns the following error:
 !Screen Shot 2016-12-16 at 14.42.12.png|thumbnail! 
 * The research for user details stops.


h3. Suggested Solution
* Make FishEye show a more graceful error
*OR*
* Do not show the user at all

h3. Why this is important
The error makes the admin think there is something wrong in the directory or in the configuration.
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like a better error management for inactive users in crowd directories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When indexing a repository, the index hangs on a changeset. Through investigation, it is discovered that FishEye enters a never ending loop. This loop was happening in a part of code where we would traverse commit ancestors graph; In case the ancestor commit was the same as the child commit we would enter a never ending loop.
fields.summary: FishEye loops on changeset while transversing commit graph

fields.description:
Currently FishEye uses [Perforce branch mappings|https://www.perforce.com/perforce/r14.2/manuals/cmdref/p4_branches.html] to link changesets to a particular branch. FishEye stores branch mappings in a HashMap and links a file revision to first matching mapping. Because of that such approach can cause problems if branch mappings overlap with each other and Perforce users change branch mappings very often. 

Such situation can lead to inconsistencies in repository structure. In example:
* the same repository indexed on different machines can result in branch discrepancies
* single file revision may have wrong predecessors

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Proposed solution:
As a system administrator or repository administrator, I want to disable branch mappings for a single Perforce repository. Currently, it is possible to disable branch mappings globally for the whole instance, via JVM System property {{fisheye.p4.disable.branchspecs=true}}
fields.summary: As an administrator/repository administrator I want to disable Perforce branch mappings for a specific repository

File diff page should be rendered with a diff between {{branch-2/file.txt@4}} and {{main/file.txt@1}}.

FishEye ignores logical paths when calculating ancestry and shows _Could not resolve revision_ banner.

h3. Summary
Using the greater/lesser symbols as part of the commit will mess with JIRA linker regex only from the "Commit Graph" tab as per the screenshot below:
* !screenshot1.png|thumbnail!  
* !screenshot2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Application Link between FishEye and JIRA and have at least commit with the commit message like {{<PROJ-1>}} for an existing project issue key in JIRA
# Create a Linker for JIRA in FishEye with the following configurations:
# {noformat}
Regular Expression: [a-zA-Z]{2,}-\d+
Href: http://<Base_URL>:8080/browse/${0}
{noformat}
# Open up Commit Graphs tab

h3. Expected Results
The list show appear as how the commit message. As from example: {{<PROJ-1>}} 

h3. Actual Results
Some gibberish random text appear before the {{PROJ-1>}} as per the screenshot above.

Note that it does not get affected in Activity Stream

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When running the [*"Release Report"*|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.fecru.plugins.fecru-revset-report-plugin/server/overview] with a user that does not have access to the repository and the "Grant read access to anonymous users" option is not enabled, a NotPermittedException error message is presented to the user.

This use case can happen when users share the URL of a report among themselves.

This has been tested against the add on version +0.15+.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that the preconditions are met:
## +userB+ does not have access to the repository
## the "Grant read access to anonymous users" option is not enabled
# +userA+ retrieves the URL of the "Release Report" and shares it with +userB+
# +userB+ opens the URL

Example of a valid URL:
{noformat}
http://fisheye/plugins/servlet/revset-report/repository1?r1=d7a10b49b030c386aba69902e99b4dc80a0bcc6d&r2=5e7cbc27ff1b77acb69f3588947e3dc5892cc17b
{noformat}


h3. Expected Results
The +userB+ is redirected to the login screen if he is not logged in.
A user friendly message is displayed if the user is not logged in.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When running the *"Code Metrics Report"* with a user that does not have access to the repository and the "Grant read access to anonymous users" option is not enabled, a NotPermittedException error message is presented to the user.

This use case can happen when users share the URL of a report among themselves.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that the preconditions are met:
## +userB+ does not have access to the repository
## the "Grant read access to anonymous users" option is not enabled
# +userA+ retrieves the URL of the "Code Metrics Report" and shares it with +userB+
# +userB+ opens the URL

h3. Expected Results
The +userB+ is redirected to the login screen if he is not logged in.
A user friendly message is displayed if the user is not logged in.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is shown in the user interface: 
{noformat}
Problem rendering report: class com.atlassian.crucible.spi.services.NotPermittedException: No permission to access repository '<repository_name>'
{noformat}

No errors or warnings are reported in the logs.

h3.Workaround
No workaround is available.

h3. Notes
A similar error has been raised against the "Release Report" here: FE-6732.
